sen.j: 堀川 通具（ほりかわ みちとも、承安 (日本)元年（1171年） - 嘉禄3年9月2日 (旧暦)（1227年10月13日））は、鎌倉時代前期の歌人。
sen.e: Michitomo HORIKAWA (1171-October 20, 1227) was a poet in the early Kamakura period.

sen.j: 堀川大納言と称されて村上源氏堀川家の祖とされている。
sen.e: He was referred to as Horikawa Major Councillor and regarded as the founder of the Horikawa family of Murakami-Genji (Minamoto clan).

sen.j: また、異母弟である道元の養父としても知られている（近年では通具を道元の実父とする説も出されている）。
sen.e: It is also known that he was the foster father of Dogen, the younger paternal half-brother (Recently, there is another theory which states that Michitomo was Dogen's real father).

sen.j: 藤原俊成の養女（俊成卿女）を妻としたが、後に離別している。
sen.e: He married the adopted daughter of FUJIWARA no Toshinari (Shunzei's daughter); however, he divorced her later.

sen.j: だが、その後も俊成の息子である藤原定家とは親しく交際を続けていた（後に定家は通具死去の報を受けて深く悲しんだという）。
sen.e: After that, however, he kept in touch with FUJIWARA no Sadaie, the son of Toshinari (It is said that when Sadaie found about the death of Michitomo, he mourned over his death).

sen.j: 主として後鳥羽院歌壇で活躍し、1201年（建仁元年）和歌所寄人となり、同別当となる。
sen.e: He mainly flourished in Gotoba-in poetry circle and became a Wakadokoro yoryudo (a key member of waka house) and betto (a chief administrator of Gotoba-in) in 1201.

sen.j: 『新古今和歌集』の撰者の一人に選ばれるが、父である源通親の代理という意味合いが強い。
sen.e: Although he was selected as one of the compilers of "Shinkokin Wakashu" (New Collection of Ancient and Modern Japanese Poetry), it strongly implies that he was just a substitute for his father, MINAMOTO no Michichika.

sen.e: He participated in 'Sengohyaku ban Utaawase' (One thousand and five hundreds Set of Poetry Match); however, he was not highly evaluated as a poet by the retired Emperor Gotoba and Teika, the best friend of Michitomo.
